page.title: 05SUPERSTITIONS
page.content: People in our area believe in superstitions, nearly all of which concern{good or bad luck.}If they see one{magpie}that is bad, but two bring good luck. Or, seeing{a black cat}is good, but breaking a{mirror}means seven years of misfortune. It is bad to put up an{umbrella}in the house, set{shoes}on the table or have{peacock {feathers}in the home, but it is lucky to find a{horse shoe.} Other superstitions concern the weather.A{red sky}in the evening means good weather, but, in the morning it is bad. Or, if the{cat}sits with its back to the fire, a storm is coming. Some people won't walk under{ladders} or look at a{funeral}through a window.
